channel.title: Hacker News - English
channel.description: Hacker News articles summarized and translated to English

item.title: SoftBank sells its entire stake in Nvidia for $5.83B
item.description:
chipmaker Nvidia for $5. The firm said in its earnings statement that it sold 32. It also disclosed that it sold part of its T-Mobile stake for $9.

HN Discussion

Read Original Article

Top 10 Comments:

ares623:

Related?

https://www.marketbeat.com/instant-alerts/filing-curbstone-f...

https://www.fool.com/investing/2025/11/11/billionaire-stanle...

blitzar:

> SoftBank Vision Fund recorded a $3.3 billion return on its Nvidia investment. The fund's February 2019 closeout of its Nvidia position preceded the AI boom and Nvidia's rapid transformation into one of the world's most valuable companies.

Masayoshi Son has form when it comes to calling the top of the market with this particular company.

xbmcuser:

We will find out in next few months but I predict they had a great exit at the high. As the AI bubble seems to be deflating even if not popping with the largest economy in the world insulating itself from western tech and AI.

rvz:

Totally not a bubble [0], Move along now, nothing to see here. /s

[0] https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=45795158

spwa4:

Well the news should probably be "sold its entire stake", as in it's already over and done.

lifthrasiir:

Note the first line:

> SoftBank said Tuesday it has sold its entire stake in U.S. chipmaker Nvidia for $5.83 billion as the Japanese giant looks to capitalize its ‚Äúall in‚Äù bet on ChatGPT maker OpenAI.

They are switching gears, not exiting, folks.

mettamage:

I'm sorry, why is this on Hacker News?

I'm on investing subreddits all the time, and I'd expect it there.

But I don't see how this is "anything that gratifies one's intellectual curiosity."

If there wasn't an AI bubble narrative, then sure, this this would gratify my curiousity. But now I don't see it, not even in the most charitable way.

I'm curious what the line of thinking is on how this does, in some way, gratifies one's intellectual curiosity.

Lionga:

I was a skeptic in AI crapware, but if SoftBank is selling Nvidia to the moon is almost a guarantee

reconnecting:

This should be the news of the day, or even should I say, the news of the last 3 years.

The bubble is starting to crack.

solumunus:

Good point to cash out in my opinion. Extremely likely you can buy NVDA back cheaper in the future.

item.title: The Write Last, Read First Rule
item.description:
We must designate a: System of Record. If the account exists here, the account exists on a system level. So which system is the system of record and which is the system of reference.

HN Discussion

Read Original Article

Top 1 Comments:

esperent:

[delayed]

item.title: Show HN: PhantomCollect ‚Äì Open-Source Web Data Collection Framework in Python
item.description:
üëª PhantomCollect Advanced Stealth Web Data Collection Framework üéØ Features üìç Precise GPS Location Tracking üåê Public IP & Geo-Location Detection üíª Complete Device Fingerprinting üì° Network & Connection Information üîã Battery Status & Power Management üõ°Ô∏è Stealth Data Collection üíæ Multiple Storage Backends (SQLite, JSON) üìä Real-time Terminal Display üöÄ Quick Start Installation pip install phantomcollect Basic Usage ```bash phantomcollect From AUR (Arch Linux): yay -S phantomcollect Access the Interface http://localhost:8080 üîß Advanced Usage Make it Public (Ngrok) phantomcollect & ngrok http 8080 Custom Port phantomcollect --port 8081 üìÅ Data Collected Data Type Details Location GPS coordinates, IP-based location Device Hardware specs, screen info, platform Network Connection type, speed, IP address Browser User agent, languages, timezone Battery Level, charging status, timing ‚ö†Ô∏è Legal Disclaimer This tool is for educational and authorized security testing purposes only. Users are solely responsible for complying with all applicable laws. üîê Security Features ¬∑ No external dependencies ¬∑ Local data storage only ¬∑ Transparent data collection notification ¬∑ Educational focus üë®‚Äçüíª Developer xsser01 - Security Researcher üìÑ License This project is licensed under the MIT License - see the LICENSE file for details.

HN Discussion

Read Original Article

Top 2 Comments:

bilekas:

This looks all very 'vibe coded' . And what exactly is the goal of the project ?

xsser01:

Instant web data collector: Launch a local server that automatically captures comprehensive visitor information including IP, location, device specs, browser fingerprints, and sensor data when anyone visits your link.
